Job Title: MD Portfolio Manager / Asset Based Lending

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
If you’re looking for a meaningful career, you’ll find it here at Webster. Founded in 1935, our focus has always been to put people first--doing whatever we can to help individuals, families, businesses and our colleagues achieve their financial goals. As a leading commercial bank, we remain passionate about serving our clients and supporting our communities. Integrity, Collaboration, Accountability, Agility, Respect, Excellence are Webster’s values, these set us apart as a bank and as an employer.

Come join our team where you can expand your career potential, benefit from our robust development opportunities, and enjoy meaningful work!

This Managing Director-level position will lead one of Webster Asset Based Lending’s four portfolio management teams with the goal of providing an excellent, proactive client experience while ensuring safety and soundness for the bank. The Team Leader is a senior ABL credit professional who enjoys client interaction, will directly manage a team of portfolio managers, be an integral member of the ABL management team and will be responsible for the team’s credit risk management, consistent with Webster’s Policies and procedures, of the ABL Client Portfolio while meeting client needs on a proactive basis. The successful candidate will enjoy the management aspects of the position including training, development, and recruitment. This position reports to the Head of ABL Portfolio Management.

In addition to strong leadership skills, the ideal candidate must possess excellent credit skills, expertise in Asset Based Lending, have a strong process orientation, a bias for action and be a true change agent, while consistently demonstrating the Webster values.

This is a hybrid position based in New York City.

Responsibilities Include

Lead and manage a portfolio management team, providing guidance, support, and mentorship to team members.Assist team members in providing proper credit structures to balance the credit appetite of the bank, and profitability hurdles with client requests.Manage the workflow of the team, ensuring proactively handling client requests, quality and timeliness of all credit work product including addressing client requests, period credit reviews, reviews of all ABL diligence materials, and timely modification of credit risk ratings.Monitor and analyze portfolio performance, identifying trends and recommending appropriate actions and escalating where appropriate.Provide effective advocacy for deals during client meetings, credit approval discussions and engage in thoughtful and respectful discussions with business line and credit partners regarding deal structure, risks and mitigants.Demonstrate effective coaching and mentoring to build upon team members’ skills and knowledge assuring appropriate habits and behaviors focusing on continuously improving the quality and consistency of the group’s underwriting, portfolio management and client coverage activities. Lead lender meetings on Webster agented transactions.Attract, select, develop, and retain top talent while promoting and championing a diverse and inclusive culture.Assure the credit work product, term sheets and underwriting documents meet all Bank policy and regulatory compliance requirements.Build and maintain strong client relationships.Support a strong risk culture for Webster Bank by conducting day-to-day business in compliance with laws and regulations, internal policies and guidelines and proactively identifying, communicating, and addressing issues warranting attention.

Educations, Skills & Experience

Comprehensive credit knowledge, ABL structuring skills and portfolio management expertise;Asset-based lending experience, including a strong understanding of collateral, required;Highly effective interpersonal & communication skills (verbal and written);10+ years banking experience; management experience a plusBachelors degree required, concentration in Finance or Accounting preferred;MBA preferredFormal Credit Training preferred

The estimated salary range for this position is $175,000 to $200,000. Actual salary may vary up or down depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position is eligible for incentive compensation.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): None
